title: Sizing considerations (BYOK)
content:
For sizing guidelines for your kubernetes cluster, refer to the the kubernetes platform's official documentation. This section provides information about the minimum dedicated hardware resources required for the suite. 

Determine the capability deployment sizes 

The suite installation may include the following capabilities: 

  • The suite
  • Design and Deploy (DND)
  • Cloud Management Platform (CMP) FinOps
  • Operations Orchestration (OO) Containerized
  • Containerized UD/UCMDB
  • Software Asset Management (SAM)

Among them, the suite capability is mandatory and the others are optional. As the first step for sizing, you need to determine the capabilities that you need and their deployment size according to your business needs. For the deployment size definitions of each capability, see Determine the capability deployment sizes.

Now, use the table below to plan the additional hardware resources for each individual DND instance. The additional hardware resources for DND is the total of the additional hardware resources for all DND instances.

Additional hardware requirements for UD/UCMDB

If using a classic UD/UCMDB

If you plan to use classic UD/UCMDB, install UCMDB Gateway on the UCMDB Server, and add the following minimal resources for UCMDB Gateway (for classic UD/UCMDB hardware resource requirements, see the Classic UD/UCMDB documentation on Sizing):

Deployment CPU RAM Disk Space
All sizes 4 cores 2 GB (allocated for UCMDB Gateway only) 100 GB

If using the containerized UD/UCMDB

If you plan to install the containerized UD/UCMDB (as the next deployment on the same OPTIC Management Toolkit (OMT)), use the following guidelines to determine the additional hardware resources required for UD/UCMDB.

  1. Determine the UD/UCMDB deployment size.

Additional hardware requirements for OO Containerized

It's recommended to use a dedicated database server for OO Containerized. Additionally, using a physical database server for OO Containerized helps in achieving optimal performance. 

If you choose to connect OO Containerized to the same database instance as the rest of the suite components, make sure the common database instance sums up both OO Containerized and the suite database requirements. 

OO Containerized shares the same NFS server with the suite.

By default, an OO Containerized installation supports up to 5 tenants. The following sizing requirements are based on running 5 tenants and not on concurrent users.
